description:
I love this spot, it's a laid back dive bar with a cool sign.

Whenever I'm in San Francisco, this spot is on my list.
author: El M.

description:
A great neighborhood dive bar!
Not too many hood rats or techies. Good chill middle of the road vibes.
Caught up with a friend and made met a lot of friendly folks. I'm giving this place 5 stars cause of the bartender Caroline. Her service was excellent and she was super friendly. There's a jukebox, pool table, and a Simpsons pin ball machine. Divey lighting, chill music level, the seats are cozy, well arranged, and it's as ideal as a dive bar gets.
author: Armando C.

description: Great dive bar. Disgusting bathroom, cheap drinks, great jukebox. What's not to love?
author: Alek C.

description:
Horribly rude bartender. It's as if she has an awful boss and she takes it out on the customers. It's a dive bar that cards you even if you're wrinkled and over 40. No iD and the bartender will demand you leave. 

No  common sense whatsoever. Place also smells disgusting. You walk in and get an overwhelming whiff of wine-o.
author: Alexandra T.

description: This is a fun quirky place. It's a super chill dive bar to check out with your friends. They have a range of beers and cocktails if you prefer. I had a beer and a tequila shot lol ($7...why not).  The staff were friendly and it was just a nice chill spot. Theres a jukebox if you prefer as well if you want to spice up some jams.
author: Natalie M.

description:
Let me preface this was saying - I'm not a dive bar person. While I can dig somewhere funky and unique far more than your average run-of-the-mill bar, a dive bar never has quite the same customers/feel to it, so I'm much more hesitant to try them out. That being said, Blind Cat is pretty awesome.

THE HIGHLIGHTS.
+ Solid beer selection (and mostly all local brews, yay!)
+ No-nonsense bartender (but seriously, what kind of jerk tries to snack on things behind the bar?)
+ There's apparently a cat somewhere in the bar?

Very cool neighborhood bar, nice people, and good drinks to be found here.
author: Claire S.

description: Nice dive bar, great prices and good service. Less than wonderful patrons; listening to two overly privileged bros complaining. Why are they in a dive bar? Clean and fun!
author: Douglas A.

description: Popped in here for my first and only visit (so far) with my sister and her friend one night -- it was suitably dark as dive bars should be.  Of course being cat lovers, we were all intrigued by the name - and then we were all in LOVE with the cute cats drawn on the various menus.  Our bartender was suitably aloof, bored and yet still provided us drinks and was not rude.  The place was pretty quiet - and bonus:  no sports playing on tvs that I can recall (I hate televisions playing constantly everywhere in public).  I will definitely visit again!
author: Jenn C.

description: Typical dive bar in the Mission.  For a Saturday night, there was a lot of comings and goings of patrons where it wasn't too packed.  The bar is clean enough, but the bathroom was pretty filthy.  Alcohol is reasonable than most places along Mission or Valencia.  Most of the bar staff was nice, but one of the bartenders was on her phone while we were trying to flag her down for drinks.  Also, something must be up with their digital jukebox, because my friend and I selected some songs and waited a half an hour to play them.  Seeing as though there weren't many people at the bar to pay for songs before us, it felt like a scam or something.
author: Chan L.

description:
Cool dive bar, not too crowded. Fun jukebox in the corner and plentiful seating available at the bar or a couple booths.

Great place to grab a reasonably priced drink, watch the Warriors game, and play some pool.
author: Tiffany C.

description: This place is cool but the bathroom is haunted with a v spooky ghost. Drinks were pretty cool. Staff was pretty cool, but spooky ghost?  I dunno man.
author: Cameron J.

description: A great location for a terrible bar, what a shame. The kind of place you might accidentally crawl into after everywhere else closes. Do yourself a favor and keep walking.
author: Tash A.

description:
I really do love this place. My absolute favorite bar in the mission to drink. They have an awesome jukebox that has a great variety of music. I played pool for the first time and had a blast. 

The drinks are well priced and considering there was only one bartender, we didn't wait long to be served.
author: Estela D.

description: Good music. Pool table. Pinball machine. So-so service. Basic neighborhood corner bar. Which, unfortunately, is getting hard to find these days.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Stopped by on a Saturday afternoon. A friend that we were with suggested this place because he said they had a good deal on drinks. A beer plus a shot for $7? Sure why not! 

The first bartender, a Caucasian guy with a beard was the first to serve us. Have no complaints about him, he was very amicable and funny. We drank our beer, took our shot. 

We saw they had a juke box so we decided to put some music on. The playlist before us consisted of 70s, newer alternative rock, and some heavy metal. Pretty much a variety and mos def random playlist ever. But that's what you expect when you have a juke box in a bar. My friend decided to play some Shania Twain, I'm not a fan myself but hey, we all have our taste in music. As soon as the song came out she yelled out a "woooo Shania". We finished till her song played and left. 

We took a walk around to check out some murals and decided to go back to the bar. As soon as we walked in, there's a Caucasian female behind the bar yelling at us to get out of the bar & that she was no longer serving us. I asked her what the reason was and she yelled,"last time you guys were in here you were really drunk. I'm not serving you, get out!" (No we were not drunk, there's been worse times) Mind you, she had a smile and a "have a good one" attitude the first time we left. She didn't seem annoyed or angry the first time. The screaming was so unnecessary. No one was raising their voice, or arguing with her. 

So embarrassing and uncalled for. I believe she just wasn't feeling our vibe and music and needed any excuse to kick us out. I wouldn't recommend this bar unless they're ready to meet a rude bartender. Totally killed our experience, will not spend another dollar in there until she is gone. I will not feel discriminated against no matter how cheap your drinks are. No thank you. 

1 star for the juke box, 2nd star for the drink special
author: Tanya E.

description:
The female bartender who was working last night was beyond rude. Someone said something about a customer being a bad doorman and she mistakingly thought it was friend and I. She proceeded to YELL at us to get out of the bar. I've never been so uncomfortable and simultaneously blindsided by confusion.

No matter who said it, I'm really not sure why it would be grounds for kicking someone out of a bar. That barkeep clearly has mental issues and should not interface with the public in a high-stress position.
author: Sara R.

description: What a great little dive bar. A good balance of hipsters and old men barflies means this place lacks pretentiousness. Grab a game of pool, pull up a spot at the bar or in one of the spacious booths. The bartender was friendly too, but what really sold me was soulful hit after hit on the jukebox.
author: Laura D.

description: Fun bar and friendly bar tender. No cat at the bar but heard the owners of the bar have a blind cat. Fun for me as I have a blind cat too.
author: Janell H.

description:
I felt Blind Cat needed an update since the last time I wrote about this place it was the beloved Dirty Thieves. Although he name changed, I still love their drink specials and bloody mary's. This place is so cool, I randomly run into my super cool friends here. :D

The bartenders are super friendly and even though they will randomly run out of certain liquors, how can you not like this place? It can get very hipsterish, but the crowd is quite diverse.

Plus where else can you watch old school classic car shows out front, watch local baseball games, play pool, listen to everything from AC/DC to Too Short. Play my song next....
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Typically dive bar.
Very laid back.
3 dollar well drinks.
Pool is $1.50.
Oh, my vodka cranberry was all vodka with a drop of cranberry, extra star for that.
author: Trang B.

description: Bearded bar tender tonight told lies to kick us out cause he didn't like my boy's appearance. It's complete bullshit and this bar has become a "marina" hole in the mission. Fuck this bar.
author: Zachary S.

description:
Definitely the divey-est bar I've been to a long time. Cheap drinks & quite the environment. 

Brought my college buddy visiting from town here & we had a blast watching a baseball game & watching the regulars get wild. If you're looking for lots of SF character & possibly the chance of leaving home with someone, this is probably your best bet. I guarantee it.
author: Juan T. K.

description:
It's your classic hole in the wall mission dive bar. I live nearby so it is a good place to stop in and have a few drinks at, but I never plan on staying long. The sign outside is cute and there is some pretty interesting art inside to look at. There is one painting however that really creeps me out  of this little kid - so beware. You'll find a pool table in the back with graffiti art on the wall behind it. It's a small place so you can quickly walk in and scope it out. 

The beer selection is pretty good, I had the Sculpin IPA last time I was there from Ballast Point in San Diego. They also had Dogfish head 90 minute IPA which is epic. I would ballpark they have 15 beers on draft. They have a modern jukebox which is always a good time. After the last time I was in I realized it is definitely a big hit for locals. It isn't far off the beaten path of Mission St and Valencia but far enough to where not a lot of out of town people are going to find it.
author: Mandy A.

description: In today's bar scene where "dive bars" have become as intentionally themed and carefully curated as tiki bars and vampire strip clubs, in a neighborhood that has spun off more stereotypes than a long running soap opera, Blind Cat manages to hold its own as a true neighborhood dive. Love it or hate it, this spot is as real as they come and that is commendable. (As are the pours.)
author: Laura N.

description:
This is one of the top dive bars in San Francisco. This hole is likely on some list somewhere because it checks all the boxes. Here are some of the boxes it checks for me:

*Dive bar prices.
*Dive bar service.
*Pool table!
*Me and a cute blonde girl on my right arm.
author: Justin S.

description: Spotted: hipster galore sketch from snl!!!  Oh wait, this isn't a funny sketch, it's actually the blind cat crowd.  Bring your beanie and your dads old wardrobe to fit in here
author: christopher h.

description: My boyfriend and I come in here on Mondays for margaritas pretty often. The bartender there on Mondays (Katie?) is awesome, super attentive, and all around pleasant to be around. Drinks are reasonably priced and there's always good music playing. Will miss this place when we leave SF in August :(
author: Allie M.

description:
A **Chilequiles Bloody Mary curated by the brass at Saison and delivered by the nifty bartenders from the Thieves brand of bad ass dive bars? Honestly, does it get any better than that?

**This ish is caliente, so if you can't stand the heat, you may want to avoid. Just sayin'...
author: Ruggy J.

description:
By the numbers, this corner pub s'got:

2 TVs
4 semi-circular tan-colored booths 
6 beers on tap (probably more but who's counting)
1 pool table
1 painting of a boy with dead eyes holding a fluffy white dog
1 jukebox
1 bartender that referred to me as "young man" 
1 old timey cash register 
lots of whiskey
lots of locals

It's cash only and no nonsense. A simple rail drink is $4. A large bottle of fernet looms mysteriously. Beers are variously priced, but that doesn't tell you much. Just stop here for a quiet drink in the afternoon or a raucous happy hour.

Obligatory Title Pun: BLIND corner.

Menu Readability: Nah.

Need to mention: Happy hour is 5-8pm.

What this place teaches me about myself: This is my spot for solo sloshin'.
author: Vivek S.

description: Blind Cat is a solid neighborhood bar.  The selection of alcohol is decent, prices are reasonable, decor is not a focus, and the bartenders are chill.  There's a pool table and a Bram Stoker's Dracula pinball machine. Last time I checked they even gave out free food from time to time.
author: John H.

description:
Happy hour!  $5 for pbr and a whiskey!  I'll take it any day. 

Comfortable neighborhood joint.  Dirty, but not that dirty. It definitely reminds me of a college dive bar. Great spot to meet up with some dudes and have a drink.  I would be a regular to this place if I lived nearby. This is an easy spot to like.
author: Corey O.

description:
"IT'S TWERK NIGHT!" the bouncer said at the door to my very male friend. "You gotta twerk to get in." So my friend shook his ass while we girls walked right in. 

Coming from near union square/SOMA, the drinks here are SO CHEAP! Sure the booths are all scratched up and you can smell the bathroom before you see it, but how often do you go to the bathroom anyway? 

Lots of beers. Your sugary friends get a randomly mystery syrupy drink that's served in a beer glass (& surprisingly GOOD). I got a couple bourbon & gingers for $7 each. The only thing stopping me from getting shwasted was CA$H ONLY so watch out! 

Not bad for a random "let's go in to any hoppin bar down this random street" find.
author: Helen W.

description: I love dive bars and everyone was super nice at this one. perfect neighborhood spot. It was my first time, but i'd go again.
author: Alexandra R.

description: Ha a great time here last night!! Met some awesome locals who I got to play pool with, it was one of the best times I've had playing pool. Also had fun playing the Dracula pinball machine even though I lost very fast. This bar has a great atmosphere to it, I'll most likely make my way back.
author: Henry C.

description:
I seem to be the only person in town who didn't know this place when it the Dirty Thieves, but while I wanted to love it, I wasn't totally charmed. It's part of the 24th and Folsom scene, which I'm nervous about promoting because I love it so much I don't want more people finding out about it. (We were there on St. Patrick's Day and we were the only ones in the bar for a moment.)

Blind Cat's main door is a half door that makes you feel like you're trespassing when you walk in. I was there meeting a friend on Sunday at 2pm, and all the dive bar staples are there (slashed up barstools, loud jukebox, damaged booths, etc.), but I was underwhelmed by the service and the $7 Three Philosophers. A few groups of regulars made their way in and out, but they all seemed to be stopping in for a quick one before they headed off to their actual destination.

If you're in the area, Blind Cat's not a bad dive bar to meet up for drinks, though I doubt I'd make a trip out just for this.
author: Kevin B.

description:
So, my first impression of this place goes like this:

It's Saturday night, I'm out with some friends, and we're looking for a dive bar. So, we walk over to the Blind Cat and dig into our pockets for our IDs. Right as we get to the door, a WALL of a man is "escorting out" a tiny, drunk man. This tiny man is yelling obscenities at the Wall (this Wall, by the way, is a person--he's massive). The Wall isn't happy about Tiny. So much so that the bouncer (who's smaller than the Wall) has to break it apart.

"I got this, Joe! I got this," the bouncer tells the Wall.

Tiny man is now outside, still yelling. The Wall ("Joe") remains inside. 

It's time to drink.

When we finally make it to the bar, the Wall is the bartender. He's as sweet as can be and offers Irish whisky recommendations with grace. He even manages to sell me on an $18 shot of Midleton Very Rare.

Well done, Wa--I mean, Joe. Well done.
author: Adena B.

description: Pinball and pool table. Wide open area in the middle could turn into a dance spot but it won't. Its a really divy spot.
author: Harry M.

description:
came here with Carla after our class...we actually just went for Tacos across the street but they don't serve beer so we came here for happy hour...

Carla can chug...im a little lightweight but I can chug too if given some time...but its happy hour, Carla's paying and having to down 3 margaritas (and I can see how she poured down that tequila, almost 2/3rds) in a Collins glass with a straw in 30 mins is enough to make my head spin...ohwait my world spin...lolol...the bartender whom im sure I asked for her name but escaped me now, was very helpful...I think she saw it in my eyes...that I was drifting...I laid down in one of the booths...until...yup....I barfed...and she helped me clean up...ohmy...*shameful*.

This bar is like 8 blocks down from where I live, but I drove that day since I came from school, a straight line/street...I don't know how I managed...I inspected Rogue (my car) the following day for dings/damages...she was fine alright...I made it to my house...staggering maybe but I did...good times.
author: Malou C.

description: Let me preface this was saying - I'm not a dive bar person. While I can dig somewhere funky and unique far more than your average run-of-the-mill bar, a dive bar never has quite the same customers/feel to it, so I'm much more hesitant to try them out. That being said, Blind Cat is pretty awesome
author: Michael D.

description:
Dive bars still need great service. 

The bartender doesn't need to smile, ask me how I am or make friendly chit chat. If I wanted that, I wouldn't go to a dive bar. What I do expect is to be acknowledged and get drinks in a reasonable amount of time, and for the staff to know a little bit about what they're serving. 

Last night the bar was slow, I sat down and watched the bartender serve a few people, then wander off to chat with friends by the pool table. I sat at the bar for 20 minutes without a drink. If I wasn't meeting someone, I would have walked out.

I ordered a beer and a Fernet, was told they didn't have Fernet and then spent an entire minute pointing out the full bottle less than a foot from the bartender's knee.

Maybe it was an off night, but it hasn't been significantly better service the last few times I have been here. 

I like Blind Cat, but it shouldn't be this hard to get a drink.
author: Quinn S.

description:
It is everything you can ask for in a dive bar. Pool table, booths with worn out seats, a juke box, and two TVs. The drinks are affordable, the bartenders nice, the company great (well my company anyways). Seems like a lot of locals come here for a quick drink. It is definitely a place I would go to have a couple drinks on a week night or a bar to stop by before going to the next destination.

Good selection of beers and a full bar. I had a whiskey on the rocks and a cider for 9 bucks total.
author: Zoe H.

description:
Skaters CHECK
Hipsters CHECK
Drunk Homeless latino out front CHECK
Amazing Hot dog stand out front CHECK
Good beer on tap CHECK
Divy atmosphere CHECK
Variety of Whiskey CHECK
Pool Table CHECK
Music CHECK
Booths CHECK

It aint the Mona Lisa but hey its a dive bar and a good one at that. Drink up!
author: Joseph M.

description: I'm in a pool league and one of my team's matches was played here. They have a great pool table considering that it's in a bar. Good jukebox selection. Both the A's and Giants games were shown on the TVs there. The female bartender was friendly. She apologized for not noticing me while I waited there (she was chatting with patrons on the other side of the bar) and had a great suggestion for a dark beer.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
This is my dive bar of choice.  Its close, its got a great selection of beer and whiskey, the barkeeps are fun and banter well.  The people are generally chill; but occasionally there are asses there.  In all its just fun to go here.

For those looking for a cheap boozing the special of whiskey and a PBR does the trick.  They also always have Duvel on tap for when you want a beer with taste.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Where can one begin while trying to describe the oasis this bar has been? Like life, this bar is full of pros and 'con's'. 

Take the mighty Jeff for instance. Every Sunday this gem of a bartender makes his own fantastic Bloody Marys for the patrons. It is a veritable cornucopia of tasty goodness for all to be had (Did I mention shrimp?). When he is not serving up his tasty 'BM'... He is a snarky, quick-witted delight for all to behold. 

In fact, almost all the bartenders are quite fun to be around, and most will mingle after a shift. The old blond one is a bit of a pill, but lovely Audrey more than makes up for her colleague's lack of personality.  

Let's get to brass tax though. You are here for the booze anyway right? This is a whiskey bar kids. If you want some pansy ass vodka drink, you are standing in the wrong building. I don't know how many different kinds of whiskey they have, but when I close my left eye and steady my head, it looks like about five hundred... Could be around fifty though, I'm not good with numbers, time, or distance. People say I'm a lot like a dog.  

Where were we? Oh yes, we were about to complain about the absolutely horrible management. That's right, the only thing in the world keeping this hole in my wall from a total gold star is the completely inept ass that is in charge of ordering the stock. By about Thursday you favorite is no longer available. On Friday your go-to runner up is gone. Saturday you are drinking the beer that didn't get sold once all week, and on Sunday you have something you would only drink if you had four of Jeff's Bloody Marys. 

I don't know who the person is that is in charge of making the bar's order, but they are a worse counter than I am. I think it is time for them to find a new mentally handicapped monkey for the job. Unlike the current one, maybe the new one can count passed four. 

If it weren't for that, and the bathrooms that made you feel like you walked into a scene from Train Spotting, it would get five stars from this whiskey loving drunky.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Dive bar. Mission-style.
Like the booths.
Bartender was really nice, his bloody Mary's were almost a meal theres so many little things tacked onto the glass. lol

Pinatas hang above the entrada.
You can smell the toilet before you're 2 ft. to the door.

Plus: The Pinball machine & pacman!!
author: Ash R.

description: this place is ok, but the jukebox in the front is a scam. if you don't play a song the bartenders like then they will quickly skip it.
author: Michael H.

description:
Don't be fooled!  This cool place is NOT just a 'Beer & a shot' place!!  Don't be afraid to ask your bartender if they like to make cocktails and if they have the time... I was in a few weeks ago and had a most amazing 'Perfect Manhattan' constructed by the young Australian lad who obviously took pride in his cocktail making skills!  After mine he made several Margaritas that were loved by those ordering!
There is a pool table, cool jukebox tunes and it was a cool crowd (on that Saturday afternoon)  Good selection of beers on tap too!
CHEERS!
author: Sean M.

description:
Ohhhh hellllooooo Shitty Kitty!  

You can't find nicer bartenders than at the Thieves establishments - they may look quite hipster/pretentious but are actually hipster/nice.  They'll only judge you a little bit if you put Hall & Oates on the jukebox.  

Plus - Bloody Mary's with SHRIMP.  I kind of just wanted them to sell me a bowl of shrimp.  Next time?
author: Rachelle P.

description: I need to make it emphatically positively sure that it is known that only a single spun-out-by-cacain trashy bartender still has not been fired from this place who still works there out of pity brings this otherwise good "joint" to a sess pool!   Whence she has lost the votes of her drug-dealing excrement's, and fired, this place will be a destination again.   ...  After I pull my bike out of the pathetic throat of the looser (her friend) that stole it.   No worries!!!   The cops have the slurryt under supervision and I can guarantee your bike won't also be stolen:   Just be sure to park it right in front of the ice machine.!!!!!  If any illiterate tells you otherwise, tell her illiterate ass simply to shut up permanently!!!!!
author: Olafur G.

description:
*******Updated 5/21/09****

Due to a very nice PM from the owner, and an offer I don't think I can refuse, I'm bumping this place back up to four stars. This is a nice and friendly bar that I do enjoy drinking at. They have a jukebox, a pool table, and a decent selection of beer and spirits.

This may not however be the right place to bring 70 people for happy hour. 

********************************

Dive bars are notorious for being badly managed. Someone inherits 50 grand and decides to buy a bar having little or no management or service skills and that's par for the course. Dirty Thieves however is owned by a guy that used to co-own a bar, Two Thieves, and he worked at Crow Bar on Broadway for years so I would expect something more..

I like this bar and wanted to introduce it to my dive bar group. It has a decent selection of beers, a pool table, and a nice open space. I posted the event and about three weeks before tried to contact the bar and let them know we were coming. I sent them an email on their MySpace page and didn't hear back. About two weeks before the event I called and tried to get any contact info for the management and they said they couldn't find it. The week before I went in to try to at least warn the bartenders we were coming because the RSVP's were growing. Finally I talk to the owner and the manager. I described my group and told them between 40 and 50 people were coming. I negotiated an extended happy hour and felt satisfied that I'd finally got through to them and everything was arranged.

The day of the event comes and I show up a bit early to introduce myself to the bartender I slap on my name tag and say " Hi I'm Tom from the Mission dive bar group" and she just looked at me like I was crazy. I said, "I'm expecting about 50 people tonight". Her eye's get big and she say's, "WHAT!!! I'm here by myself". I told her that it was all arranged as well as the happy hour agreement, she should call the manager to verify and that we were a patient group so she shouldn't worry. She did a great job, and probably had a great night tip wise but that isn't really the point. This whole thing was a communication cluster f*ck.

The event turned out to be bigger than I expected and there was more like 70 people that showed up for it. I conservatively added $750 dollars to their receipts for the night and $150 to the tips. I feel like all my drinks should have been comped but I wasn't even floated a single one for free.

I like drinking here but it's too disorganized for me to ever use it as an event venue again.
author: Manny F.

description:
A dive bar in the Mission that's not full of hipsters?! What is this, bizarro world?!

I wandered into this place at the direction of a very gracious local host. It seems to be a tad off the radar, but hat could be due to the fact that it was a Thursday night, and not in the full weekend swing. 

I was confronted by a small, dark space with cool rounded booths, an awesome selection of liquor (including Old Potrero18th Century Style Single Malt at $15  for a healthy shot), friendly, unpretentious service, a cash only bar, and a chill crowd that consisted of a mix of old and young professionals alike (professional drinkers, that is). There are 2 flat screens above the bar, which turns this from a dive bar into... well... I don't know what kind of bar to call it, but I like it. A divey lounge? It's not a sports bar, and the higher-end selection of brown liquor makes me shy away from the dive category. Whatever. It defies categorization, and that's probably why I liked it so much. 

Plus, I got to watch the Lakers lose on their home court in the playoffs. 

There's a pool table in the back, and the juke was playing some classic rock... not top-40 classic rock, but some quality lesser-known jams. Some of the older dudes were dancing around the bar to the particularly rockin' tunes. Everyone seemed to be down. 

There's a pool table in the back as well, which is another plus that would keep me coming back to Dirty Thieves time and again.
author: Don B.

description: Why have a jukebox if you're not going to allow paying customers to enjoy it? This bartender not only complained openly about not liking the music being played, she even turned it way down. If you want to have a few drinks and enjoy some r&b, don't go here. If you like country music, this is the place for you.
author: Miles J.

description:
Okay so here is my pet peeve: just because a place doesn't look brand new or serves some whiskey--that doesn't make it a dive bar.  

A dive bar is more than just a cool neighborhood bar.  You should feel 
a little bit like you are taking your life in your hands at a dive bar.  You should feel as if Tom Waits could be sitting down at the end of the bar, or that you might have to step over Charles Bukowski on the floor of the bathroom.  (Yes the ladies room--that dirty dog!)

Just because they didn't clean the place up the other night, doesn't mean they're a dive bar any more than I am a diva just because I belt out a mean drunken karaoke of "I Kissed a Girl!"  So when I find a place like this categorized as a dive bar--I have to protest.  Dive bars do not get the same clientele as Elbo Room.  This is a neighborhood bar with hipster leanings that happens to serve some mean whiskey drinks.  (No I'm not drunk right now! Never drink and yelp!)

So what's my point? Okay, nothing. I really dug this place. Me and my Jesse Eisenberg lookalike of a date (he loves it when I point out his resemblance), came here after our semi-successful salsa night.  The atmosphere was really pretty cool and crowded. We shared a booth with this hipster and his tattooed girl and had a blast. He was one of those conspiracy theory guys who thinks Bush did 9/11 and the moon landing was a hoax.

The juke box is great in this joint and the drinks really pack a kick.  Jesse had to help me back out of the place because they kept on sliding the pub walls back and forth by the time I got up. Darn trick bars pretending to be dive bars!
author: Nikki K.

description:
Is this place seriously fucking called Blind Cat now?!

5 STARS BITCHES. MEOW
author: Jillian M.

description:
Previously I made the mistake of visiting Pop's. This place, Blind Cat is by far my new favorite place in San Francisco! 

My lil brother and I walked in stumbling from previous drinking. We both sat at the bar, very good decision if you wan to have great conversation with Mike the bartender and whoever sits next to you, that by this time they might be drunk already.

Drinks are also cheap Modelo's was 3 dollars and kamikazes 4 dollars! (I think I might moved up here for the bars) as the late hours passed us by both my lil brother had an interesting night meeting unique individuals and having awesome conversations. .. I think I found my new hole in the wall, too bad is all the way here in Frisco. 

Shout out to Davvie, the construction worker who inspires to be a firemen, passionate about poetry who live across the street from the Blind Cat. You will not be forgotten ; )
author: alvarez p.

description: Nina Simone on the juke box. 'nuff said.
author: danica s.

description:
This place is bizarre. Never a dull moment here. I had no idea it was called the Blind Cat now. The drinks are cheap and the bar tenders are downright cool. We once went there and they were out of " everything" except beer on tap or some such strangeness.  Some nights it's a good dive-y vibe with all sorts of folks and sometimes it's a flashback to 1986 SF high school skater parties-- super drunk and obnoxious guys throwing their skateboards around-what are you, 12?  

Good jukebox, but get to it early.

I hate it, but I like it. Depends on the day.
author: Uda W.

description: Best dive bar ever! Cash only type of place so be sure to visit an ATM before coming here ;)
author: Marissa Q.

description:
The dude I was couchsurfing with brought us here.  This place is amazing, and I felt lucky to visit as a "tourist."  

The drinks are cheap ($4) and strong, and the bartenders were friendly and quick moving.

So many characters in this bar, and was the highlight of our San Francisco nightlife experience.
author: Whitney R.

description:
Total neighborhood dive bar with a few interesting pieces of art dotting the walls. I tend to gravitate towards bars with a better selection of beer on tap when I come to the Mission, but there was a Yelp get-together here so it was a good excuse to check the place out.

It was Saturday night, the Giants were closing out the Phillies in the NLCS, and only one bartender in this packed little place? Still, she handled all the business like a champ! I like all the various Anchor Steam offerings on tap, but in this day and age, no IPA?? 

One serious note to the bartender working Saturday night. I hope you guys read these reviews. I know you guys have to put up with a lot of drunken B.S. on a nightly basis. Total apologies for my cousin taking a beer outside of the establishment. He deserved the reprimand and I understand why you guys got so pissed. Also? I thought your no-nonsense demeanor was hot. I'd come back just to watch you do your thing!
author: Nate R.

description:
So, it can be overlooked that I once saw on Gangland that certain gangs roll by and shoot each other here. No biggie. 

PROS: Whiskey and Pabst deals. Pool table. Booths!

CONS: Creepy men. Oh, what the hell, i know it's the mission so whatever. 

Not my fave but it'll do. it'll do. I will say that I'd much rather go to Dirty Thieves than Pop's on ANY given night.
author: Nicole K.

description: Sure, there are cheap drinks to enjoy in this darkened bar. But all that really matters is the bartender, Jeff, who has the ass of a god perfectly perched on his 6'6" frame. Swoon.
author: Mel H.

description:
Cheap drinks, great people, and excellent dive-yness. The few booths are excellently bouncy and a trip to the bathroom will convey to you how it's possible to be charmingly dive-y without a dive-y smell. Ahhh, the charm. 

On top of all that my taco heaven is almost directly across the street. Tacos + beer. What else would you possibly need?
author: Loli L.

description:
Pool Table in the back
Cash only drinks in the front.  Dimly lit, friendly people and friendly staff.
A sure hit if you like dives
author: Carlos S.

description: I rolled to Thieves after work to Hang out with the East bay & SF Softball Posse and Catch the Giants game. Bart made my jaunt very easy. I was at Thieves in 40 minutes flat not bad. Thieves is a Cool Dive Bar and it was Packed with Giants Fans watching the game. They have a Pool table in the rear of the bar. There's a hallway that leads to the Restrooms. They have a nice long bar with 3 Bartenders. Beers on tap are reasonably priced. The Yelp Posse was situated in one of the Booths and Standing around it. Always nice to hang with Yelpers such a fun bunch of folks . Thieves was a great place to watch the Game. When Wilson sealed the deal the Bar Erupted in celebration. Definitely a cool neighborhood bar to hang out at. The Mission was a giant party after the win.
author: Eugene L.

description: I'm not sure what I was doing here. It's your classic dive bar, though I may be getting too old to be diving. Nice bartender, odiferous bathroom, chill atmosphere. I'll definitely come back when I'm ready to feel young again.
author: Kent L.

description:
What a wild Friday night!!!  Writing this review tonight (Sat night) since for the first time in ages, I had such a wild night drinking with friends that I actually couldn't yelp or look at the computer screen this morning without feeling nauseous.

After an especially crazy day yesterday (in a different way), I met up with the McPhee here late afternoon for some drinks.  What a great bar!!!  I remember coming here one wild drunken evening years ago when it was called Treat St.  Well as it turned out, history repeated itself.

Lauren the bartender was fantastic...she totally rocks!!!  Jessica was super cool too.  Great local bar...interesting clientele and everyone there in the early evening was outgoing and super friendly.  Nice big place and a great pool table in the back too, although the bumpers could use a little work.  Someone picked some fantastic tunes on the jukebox too.  Good times!!!

Had a bunch of drinks here before we headed to the tenderloin and the Nitecap for more drinks.  Not upscale, but the perfect neighborhood dive bar...I wish this place was closer to home, I'd be in here a lot.  As I was leaving, War's "Spill the wine" started playing on the jukebox...definitely a fun place!
author: Roy N.

description:
Fun dive bar near everything!

This is a great place with a great location. I do wish it had a better beer selection but it makes up for it in fun staff, excellent juke box, and decent spirits. The bar is actually quite open and airy (for a dive) and there is lots of room for dancing if you feel like it (and some people do)

I like this place a lot
author: Eric G.

description: Typical dive bar. Kinda gross if you look too closely, but no big deal if you're just in the mood to talk loudly to your neighbor, listen to a random assortment of music, and drink a $7 tall boy PBR and whiskey shot special.
author: A P.

description:
Hole in the wall/Dive bar - Strong Drinks, Internet Jukebox with almost any song you'd ever think of, beat up booths, pool table in the back, random crowd, and nice staff.  

Had some pretty crazy good nights at this dive bar; it's definitely my kind of bar.
author: Audra E.

description:
"ALL RIGHT - LAST CALL FOLKS! Y'ALL GOTTA GET OUT OF HERE SO WE CAN GET GOIN!"

I looked at my watch and it was 10:45, on a Saturday night!? WTF? This was even after a few "stumbles" by the barkeep at this point. When we first got there, the guy was talking to his buddy at the end of the relatively empty bar for at least 5 minutes before I could order a Bud Light (I'm watching my figure these days) and a premium G&T for the lady. 

He gives me a Miler Lite instead but makes the G&T pretty stiff so I give him the usual tip.

Later on, the guy tries to engage us in a conversation about the "Hair Band Special" playing on VH1 on the tele. Unfortunatley, he was talking under his breath and so incoherent we just smiled at him and hoped he'd move down the bar to talk to his buddy.

Strange bar...unlike my girl though, I'd still give it another chance.
author: Art O.

description:
This is when yelp's star system becomes relevant to the type of business you are reviewing.  In this case, yes, this is a four star dive bar!
I mean, what could possibly go wrong at a joint located between "Lucky" and "Treat" streets?!  
The bloody marys are as legendary as they say.  About 14 different toppings including a shrimp and 2 pretzels drinks like a meal ... for $5!  
Bonus: there is a regular there named Celia who sits belly up to the bar with her walker situated right behind her bar stool.  If you're lucky she'll say something really raunchy to you. And it will somehow be charming.
author: e w.

description:
Was raging it here for a while on the Fourth of July.

Good crowd.  It wasn't overcrowded but it wasn't empty either, and everybody was friendly and having a good time.  Another bonus, when going outside for a smoke break, people in the neighborhood were lighting off fireworks, and a few of them were actually decent.

Bartenders were on point, real quick service.  When it was my turn to buy a round, one of the kegs went out on one of the beers I needed to get.  Some places have bartenders who would just be like, we're out, what else could I get you but these fools just changed the keg real quick and didn't make an issue out of it.

This bar has a good layout too.  Long bar with lots of seats, some booths and tables for groups opposite the bar, and at the far end an open area with a pool table and possibly some dart boards(I was kinda drunk when I got here and definately drunk when I left so I'm not 100% on the dart boards).
author: Brad R.

description:
Boy does this place have good yet cheap drinks! I'm consistently impressed by the price of the drinks here, chill vibe, spaciousness, large booths, free pool table and happy hour specials. I greatly enjoy their surprisingly nice collection of whiskey, scotch and bourbon, and knowledgeable, skilled bartenders. Couple that with being super close to 24th Street BART and tons of great Mexican food nearby and you got yourself a no-brainer!

Happy hour runs until 8pm: $3 drafts (except Chimay) and well drinks. There's also always a whiskey + tall boy special of some sort going on for around $7.
author: Kristina A.

description:
Why would any right minded person come to this place willingly?

Dirty Theives, is dirty, smelly and gross ... plus everyone in there scared me. I was convinced I'd catch hepatitis if I sat down. 

Still, after lunch, I went with friends who wanted to catch a beer inside. We stuck around for about an hour ... an hour too long. 

I don't understand, in ALL of San Francisco, why come here? so many better bars out there.
author: Sunny D.

description:
Wandered into this spot today looking for a few beers and place to watch the world cup that wasn't ridiculously crowded (because, all americans are soccer fans all of a sudden)... Anyway, the atmosphere was super chill - the staff and the patrons were really friendly, and the setup of the bar was very inviting.  Some dive bars have a really "local" attitude, but there wasn't any of that here. 4/5 stars ONLY because of the size of the place - regardless of the size, the place is setup pretty well so that you don't feel crowded.  You can get a drink at the bar, slide into a booth or pull up a stool at the window near the pool table - either way there are plenty of places to root yourself without feeling like you're in the way of traffic. 

A Cool spot def. worth checking out if youre in the area.
author: Warren R.

description: Kronenberg for $4? I am in. Cool crowd, super friendly bartenders, can't ask for more. Totally what i would expect from a dive bar in any area. Local flavor cannot be better described, really!
author: Natasha B.

description: Kit Kat Bar! It's cheap and SF is a suck dick expensive city. One of the bartenders has great pour style and gives me plenty o' that sweet well whiskey. Also the crowd isn't all yuppies. Sometimes I'm the only yuppie there! Yay!
author: Sandy V.

description:
Cash only. Decent size booths.Good Beer.

Bathroom not so great but I have seen worse.
author: Lidia Z.

description: Illest bar in The City. Nothing quite like a rained out ballgame at this place.i
author: Gerardo S.

description:
it's currently undecided whether or not Blind Cat gets me super drunk because i had already been drinking by the time i end up here or because it's just that kind of place.

... perhaps it's both reasons.

walking by Blind Cat prior to ever going in to drink, i'll say that i wasn't sure what to expect.  though i should have known it would be just fine when the lovely folks at Blind Cat let me stumble in to use their bathroom after getting drunk somewhere else.

my first time here i was chatting it up with some of the bartenders... one of them i ended up seeing at Target a day or two later (he recognized me and remembered my name).  that's cool.  cool cool cool.

i could tell you another story but it's completely irrelevant and all you need to know is that this place is pretty alright.  do it.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Walked in at 4pm on a Wednesday. 
Ordered a shot that was the size of a drink and a tall PBR for 7 bucks. Not too shabby.
Kinda empty but the people that were there were hott ass hipsters.
Bartender was a damn sweetie. Loved her.

Will for sure be back here soon.
author: JJ C.

description:
The owner runs a skanky, foul place. It's unsanitary, and if you notice how the dark skinned guy handles glasses and ice, you would request an antibiotic!

Skip this place, unless you like skank holes with attitude. There are far too many GOOD places in the Mission, without the attitude, and without the bacteria
author: Ted K.

description: Went in real quick to get a drink and see the score and possibly stay in but when I asked the female bartender for an absolute mandarin soda water with a lime she turns around and tells me they don't carry flavored vodka. I ordered just a normal vodka soda water drink instead. I looked at the various types of liquors only to see they had Ketal One Citroen, WTF? She could of upgraded her sale..oh well, cute bar  but not the bartender.
author: Marco R.

description:
Five-star dive-bar.  Okay, so I'm biased because I have a friend who owns the skateshop across the street...so we wind up lurking at Dirty's as much as we do at the shop...and I know all the bartenders! I heart Logan! Jeff's bloodymarys are reaching mythical statuses...plus ppl get #jealous when I #twitpic the bloodymary pics so they must be damn good! Perfect for that Sunday hangover...right after you stumble off your hill at DP. LOL. But don't get it twisted, it's still the Mission Dist. If you're from the City, you know exactly where you're at. 

I'm sure gonna miss Logan when she goes to NYC tho'...enjoy them sloppy joes while you can!

Oh, I almost forgot, I watched almost all the #SFGiants play-off games there last year. The atmosphere was #RIDIC!!! And when we won the World Series it was like a craaaaazy street party on 2-4!!! Definitely somewhere to watch games if you're a Giant's fan. #blackandorange! Alll day in there!
author: Chris M.

description:
Yes i like it here, even though this is one of those spots where you get serious drunk, I am not really sure why, i get handed beers and shots and of course I drink them.
What happens after that is blurry, I always miss the bus and end up in cab.

I LOVE the bartenders here, tip them good!
author: cecilia k.

description:
(Creepy old man starts following us around during Carnival.)

BarmanPaul: That's what you get for bringing your own Tanqueray into Thieves Tavern.

(http://www.yelp.com/biz/RSgLq_3ilNT2eO4BU85p3g?hrid=583bx99Tu-pfPESwkZkFyA)

Keane: OHH......  

(Karen K.: You have a fucking rep now!)

BarmanPaul: Are you paying for both of these drinks or just yours?

Keane: Just mine... I don't even know what this other one is.

BarmanPaul: It's straight tonic and lime... cuz you brought your own gin, right?

Oh, SNAP!

Playa done serrv'd me good...

Friendly and fun staff and doorguy: a billion stars.
Creepy clientele: a trillion leave-me-the-FUCK-alone stars (yes, they make those).
author: Keane L.

description:
Leave your pearls & Prada at home--you're in hipster country now.

CASH ONLY!
Cheap drinks ($4 gin & tonics)...also packed fair punch.
Decent bar service (granted, I was there around 11:00pm....got harder to flag down the bartender after midnight).
Pool tables in back.
Booths are good for groups.
Volume level is manageable and vocal chord friendly.

Overall, good low-key hangout to grab a drink & chat.
author: Amy K.

description:
Stop me if you've heard this one...

Two yelpers enter a bar.  

One with a hangover the other along for the ride 

...until Newcastle is spotted on tap.  By the way, Newcastle on tap earns an automatic four stars and turns me into a sloshed, day drinkin', foul mouthed drunkard.  (Awesome) Add some Whiskey and I just turn into an ass-hole. (I'm OK with that)

Here are the quick and dirty details as I'm far too hungover to be clever.

These are skilled bartenders!  They're gregarious and knowledgeable and generous with their knowledge of Whiskey.  Dirty Thieves is part of the thieves legacy.  

Whiskey Thieves
Thieves Tavern 
and Dirty Thieves

Whiskey appears to be their thing.  So, you'll find more top shelf Whiskeys here than any divebar has a right to have on hand. 

I was introduced to a Whiskey that didn't make me want to puke called 1792( Hey Paul I totally remembered!)

The J-box is pretty fantastic as well.

 I don't care what this place used to be.  Its a pretty great place now!
author: R M.

description:
So you take over Treat Street Cocktails...

...and you remove all the inherent charm of the familiar decor (most notably the impressive collection of taxidermied animals, which constituted a veritable zoo of random [albeit motionless] wildlife)...

...and you raise the price of Treat Street's signature beer + liquor special...

...and then, on top of it all, you seem to do NOTHING to compensate for this blatant shift towards blandness.

If I could yawn loud enough to shake apart the walls of this newly dulled drinkery, I would. Frankly, I don't get it. Why remove the decor of one bar without replacing it with something new? That's like going to a friend's dorm room in college, ripping down his "Scarface" and "Reservoir Dogs" posters, but putting up nothing in their place...thus leaving a box of empty concrete-block walls with no soul or personality to speak of.

Frankly, I first discovered this "new look Treat Street" immediately after the new owners took over the former Treat Street location. So I intentionally stayed away for many, many weeks...thus giving them the chance to make their own personalized mark on the space. When I finally returned this week, NOTHING had been improved. It was still the same lifeless void. And, to make matters worse, the old Treat Street Cocktails sign is still hanging outside!

Frankly, these "Thieves" owners and their chain bars have all the personality of a Banana Republic. They seem to think they can be simultaneously classy and communal. BZZZZ! Sorry, kids. You're bland, you're boring, and you're bringing the entire charisma level of San Francisco down to your own flatline level.

Have you thought of buying some bars in San Jose instead? That city already sucks. Maybe they won't mind your inherent milktoast sensibilities. I, however, certainly DO NOT want to see you put your stale and lifeless mark on any more bars in San Francisco.
author: John G.

description:
Awesome.

Decided to go here for a nightcap.

Monday night is (apparently) movie night.  They were playing Gremlins.  Good choice... In the holiday spirt and all.  I was kind of tripping about going in this joint because I used to live less than a block away when it was still Treat Street Bar.  I had never gone there, but saw a lot of strangeness go down outside.

Anyhow...  I found a stool and pulled it up to the bar.  I ordered a Jack and Coke for only $5!  SWEET!  The bartender (female - didn't get her name) was not only personable, but checked in a few times to make sure I had plenty to drink.  

The other thing I really like about the place is that there are comfy looking booths and they aren't directly smashed up behind the bar stools, leaving an area about the size of a stripper's "landing strip", for a walkway.  This place actually has room enough to dance, should one be so inclined.

A friend of mine suggested we start a list of at least 5 bars/hood that we frequent that are our "go-to" bars.  Dirty Thieves would definitely be on the list for The Mission.
author: MoMo D.

description:
An amazing bourbon, rye, and whiskey selection for reasonable prices.  

What are you doing on a rainy afternoon?  I recommend sipping your day away.
author: MJ C.

description:
I'm the mothaflippin' Mayor, bitches.

so don't you mother uckers go ucking with my shiii!

This place is the Mecca ('sup Mwow) of the excellent letter B.
Booze, Bourbon, Billiards, Booths, Bloody Marys, ..and uhhh Bathrooms!

In addition to these, let me remind you: excellent, things, they feed you sometimes too.  

On Saturday, you can grab some free grilled PB&J's with drinks.  On Monday, I think it's Monday, but it might be Wednesday, you can get Sloppy Joes.

There might be some other food thing another night, but it escapes me.

The Bloody Marys are practically a meal as well.  On the weekend they come with little toasts and a shrimp, as well as a variety of pickled veggies and olives.  But don't make Mwow's mistake:  Just because a Bloody Mary has a delicious little toast and shrimp, it is not a meal.

so don't you forget:  There ain't no party like my nanna's tea party.
author: Adam C.

description:
Treat Street used to be my favorite dive in the Mission. It was never packed, the jukebox was always available and it had a 4 square Polaroid photo booth. Oh, and they served Stella for cheap in goblets as is proper and makes one feel downright fancy. It was hip in the most unhip way possible. There was always at least one dog in there. It almost felt like a secret bar. 

But then... it became Dirty Thieves. 
First of all, how embarrassing is it to ask your friend to come out and meet you at Dirty Thieves? Seriously, no better names were available? 
Secondly, and most importantly, the photo booth? Gone. That's right. The only thing that could usually convince a group of people wanting to go to Pops to go to Treat Street was that it was usually closer to wherever we were coming from and they had the Polaroid photobooth. But alas, booth gone, new terrible name and... I'm not digging it. 
DT is sadly officially crossed off of my mission dive bar crawl list for good.
author: Callie K.

description:
My fave local dive. Seriously, it's like 20 drunken steps from my house.

They have a full bar, awesome bartenders, an even awesomer jukebox, a slew of sexy lady pictures on the wall, and don't seem to mind when i start to slur my words. Err....

My only complaint is that this bar is usually a dude-only, sausage fest. Where are all the cool ladies in my hood?
author: eve l.

description:
yeah yeah, i give everyone 5 stars...so what.  I, unlike some heartless bastard yelpers, don't want to see businesses fail - unless I really think they should.  

I know the owners of these bars almost too intimately.  Ask Mike about the time at Emmy's Spaghetti Shack AND ask Paul about one fine New Year's spent in with some grappa and the broom closet.
author: Jilly B.

description:
Disclaimer: I would be lying if I didn't say I love this place because of a certain tall and handsome bartender.  Well, that and it is around the corner from where I live.
But don't get me wrong.  Just because I scope out who is behind the bar before I walk in, this place is great. Sure it's not the same as it was years ago, but hey times change.  Still a dive bar, but I'm not scared to touch the handle to the bathroom.  The art on the walls change. Cheap and strong drinks. Thumbs down to the beers on tap (boring/typical). Pool table, pin ball, jukebox, TV's and interesting locals.
author: Maria L.

description: Love this bar and have always had a great time here but wow we must have gotten the bartender on her rag cuz she, for no reason at all, refused to serve my brother. When we asked her why she responded by saying "if you have a problem with it you can leave too!" She then took mine and my friends beer and whiskey away from us. We had already paid for the drinks. I honestly have no idea what she had against my brother except that he walked in and said "hello ladies". Possibly men issues? I dont know? Shes a dirty blonde white chick. Works there frequently. Never had a problem with her or anyone for that matter until a few days ago. She may be the one that others have mentioned as being "a bit of a pill". I still love this place.. they've got a great whiskey and beer special...awesome crowd... but wow blonde bartender has rage... beware of her she'll take your money, take your drinks, and kick you out (or have her feminine sounding boyfriend do it).
author: Cena V.

description: People that walk into the Blind Cat should love it. It's value proposition is clearly communicated from outside. If a dive bar is what you are looking for, the Blind Cat delivers. Drinks are cheap, bar tenders are awesome, you can park your bike inside if its not too crowded. Best place for a drink on the 24th Street Corridor.  Happy hour Special: $7 for a beer and a Jamesons. No Brainer.
author: Christian Z.

description: deep in mission...having had dinner and few drinks already...few late night taco snacks...ending at dirty thieves...grungy dark bar, but fairly large...pool table far back, but the bar from entrance to center the main attraction...special $seven for pbr tallboy and simple shot of jameson whiskey straight up....heavy pour past shot line marker...pbr beer chaser not tasty, but for $seven will drink...mention chimay on tap...room for standing, leaning and chatting...farewell to a friend leaving for the east....originally from the east coast...returning back home after lengthy stay in the warm west...
author: Hen A.

description:
Yeah, serious dive bar.  The bartender was friendly, if not drunk, enough.  She apologized for going off shift in the middle of my order, but she came back and gave me a hug and invited me to go to another bar that she was going to work...

Sigh, yeah, I've been to better...
author: Herman P.

description:
This bar has cheap drinks, a WORKING pool table, a great jukebox, and two brightly colored flat screen televisions for your viewing pleasure.  

Not lots of sitting room, but plenty of standing/dancing room. 

Definitely a happy hour-watch the game and chill dive kind of place.

Oh, if you really like Pabst, go ahead...order one...because it MIGHT BE FREE.  Pabst has random playing cards printed on their caps.  The bartender usually lets you take a guess and if you get it, it's free.  Yes...I never win anything, anywhere, except for Pabst at this place.
author: Brian M.

description:
Please, yea as they suggest- just head on down the road to Pops will ya?
Their bartenders are less friendly and more Williamsburg, perhaps you'll feel more at home there than with us dirty ones.
Let me enjoy my Merle Haggard on the jukebox, seats for me and my friends and the entertaining antics of drunken locals without you getting in my way. 
Thanx.
author: M. B.

description: Drinks are CHEAP and the service is friendly, but just abusive enough to keep me coming back for more.  Even when they are out of my first choice (even second choice) of beverage, I don't seem to mind, as it gives me an opportunity to try something new....which usually ends up being some sort of fire starting whiskey or bourbon (curses!).  I regularly enjoy Sunday happy hour which involves:  the best bloody marys in town, and most recently "champagne" in a can.  *Applause*
author: Katrina M.

description:
I used to like Treat St. on sunny afternoons for BBQ. It was always pretty scummy, but good times. Now known as Dirty Thieves, ala the great libation throwing team of Whiskey Thieves & Thieves Tavern, it's got a bit better vibe and extra special wonderful bar staff.
Super Sunday BBQ times!!! They new folk know how to keep it goin' Treat Street style! (they pour 'em strong)
author: Colleen B.

description:
I love going to this place.

In the Mission I find that there are either too many people, not enough people or just a bunch of a-holes at every bar.  This place is always just about right and it has everything I want.  First, there is a big tv in the corner.  Why is the Mission so anti-tv?  It sucks that I have to drive across town or stay home to watch a ball game.  Second, everybody who hangs out in there is pretty mellow and cool. And finally, they have a juke box and a drunk guy that blasts stadium rock in there all night.  

This really has become my favorite place to hang out and drink beer in the city.
author: doug s.

description:
disclaimer: since i first posted this review i've been contacted by the bars management and they have assured me that the guy who harassed me was NOT an actual employee of the bar and basically just an opportunistic bully. they have been really nice and sensitive about the incident, and so towards that end i want to say that i no longer think of the bar or its management as homophobic. that said, i do think we all need to be respectful of other people and be vigilant against this kind of behavior. don't put up with other people's prejudice. San Francisco is only cool if it's inclusive of everyone. i've left the rest of this review as a reminder that B.S. like this still happens. 


yesterday (june 3rd) i was at a function at alley cat books a block away from this bar that use to be treat st/dirty thieves.... i use to live at harrison and 24th and come here all the time... anyway, i walk in to get a drink and the door man with his 4 friends says 'WHOAAH get a load of this guy' and stops to check my I.D.
 he then says laughingly while looking at my CA I.D. 'thats not a man, thats a woman'...  now, i'm a cis male and at the time i was wearing shorts and a bright pink flannel, queer looking sure, but its also pride month and the alley cat was hosting a bunch of art and performances, walking directly across the st from that environment to have to deal with some dick at the door trying to emasculate and ridicule me? hell no...
 I said to the door guy 'I think we both know that it says right there on the I.d. that I'm a male, and I think we both know your being homophobic,' to which he replies 'take a walk'...
 did i call him an @$$hole? sure did. its ridiculous to have to deal with that kind of prejudice in san francisco in 2012... sure, 24th st has changed alot... theres more book stores, ice cream and coffee shops and hip boutiques then there were 6 years before, and the energy is always changing, but i still think we can all agree that the reason we liked sf was because of its diversity and sense of inclusion. from now on every time i talk about this bar, it'll no longer represent that... from now on everyone i talk to about this bar is going to hear about how their door man was a homo/transphobic dick, and how people like me arn't welcome in a place we use to think of as home.
author: Jack B.

description: great staff, but often out of the drink or booze you want, but the staff will make me come back.
author: Genea B.

description: I recently moved to this neighborhood and was wandering the streets to look for a comfortable bar with decent music. Well, the blind cat is that and more. It is a dive bar, but the bartenders are great and so are the drinks. It's never too crowded so I can always find a place to rest my feet. I think this may be my new neighborhood hang out.
author: Jamie P.

description: Cheap drinks. Beer n shot specials. Originally from Detroit and wanted a nice dive to sit and relax. This fit very well.
author: Daniel P.

description:
Great dive.

Just what a dive bar in SF is supposed to be ....

dark, rustic (old), variety of characters (both nice & normal as well as "San Francisco quirky"), a bit unorganized, good juke box, a pool table, booths (which didn't have any rips or tears), convenient location, no attitude, a REAL happy hour special:  $5 for a shot of whiskey and tall can of PBR, unlike mainstream, upscale bars that entice you in for a $6 cosmo

The men's bathroom has a urinal AND a toilet, which means two guys can piss side-by-side rather than have to wait outside for the uptight yuppie to finish draining his lizard.  And they actually have a soap dispenser WITH soap, hot & cold running water, AND paper towels.

The bartender was nice enough. If you don't get a bartender with attitude in this town, you're off to a good start.

Plenty of space, it's not cramped, overall a good vibe with accepting, tolerant people who come here to enjoy themselves, talk with friends, and get shitfaced too. I was pleasantly surprised with the selection of quality (if not too pricey) whiskeys.

Lastly, you can bring food in here, which is awesome considering the multitude of great cheap Mexican eateries along 24th street. I also managed to pick up some cheap household items and paint supplies at the dollar store next door.

Great spot.
author: Scott T.

description: Didn't realized they changed the name ... whatever. Great happy hour specials and lovely, dive-y atmosphere. Where else in SF can you get a tall PBR and a shot of good brown liquor for $7? 2 of those and your worries are forgotten, then grab some free grub. Bartenders are pretty groovy too. Wish I lived closer, though my liver is happier I don't.
author: Scott B.

description: A proper neighborhood mission bar. Yes, of course, it has it's fair share of trucker hats and dodgy facial hair, but it's also a nice chill place to grab a (cheap) drink and relax without being too much of a scene. I was here on a Wednesday evening and it was fairly busy, but service was prompt and friendly.  Not the widest selection of beers, and, surprise surprise, its mostly cheap canned beer to choose from. Bonus points because they have Strongbow cider in the bottle which I have never seen this side of the pond (yeah, I know it's a girly drink, but on a hot day...).
author: Tom M.

description: Awesome.  There's always the cheap pbr, pool table, dogfish 90 and rocking.
author: Danny B.

description:
Hate Hipsters like me, but want to hang in the Mission? Like drinking "the brown"(whiskey,bourbon,scotch,rye?) They have most of the good ones.
Cheap, cold PBR.
Awesome Soul, Punk Jukebox.
Saturdays have some hipsters hanging out, but during the week this place is the spot.
Treat Street Lives!
Wish the taxidermy was still here, but the art is getting better.
author: Rick H.

description: Dive bars are great!  I love them because they serve things like $6 jameson shot (big shot) with a pbr back.  Like what? Yes weird mix but awesome!! Turned my drizzly foggy day into warm and sunshine on the inside :-D
author: becca w.

description:
My favorite bar in San Francisco.  It just is.  If it still had a photo both it'd be paradise, but I swear, this is my St. Elmo's.  They have Chimay on tap, there's usually a table open, there's an ATM, a place with veggie tacos across the street and my closest SF friends either live close by, or always seem willing to come here.
I really do think this place does something to people.  It's like the beer is magical and suddenly we are all in good moods, the night last forever, last call never comes and I really like that it has a dutch door.  I like dutch doors.  
But really: the staff is nice, and, since I'm very sure NO thought went into the design or seating arrangement, it just  worked out well, because it's very conducive to conversation, the juke box is FABULOUS (T-Rex, Fleetwood Mac, Bruce Springsteen, Wings...it's the BEEEEEST).  It makes me hapy just thinking about it.
author: Jamie H.

description:
I walk by this place every day on the way home from work. I've been in a handful of times, and the one positive trait that stands out about it is the pool table and punk rock juke box.

It's definately divey.

Alot of times when I walk by there are beautiful nerdy boys with beards and tattoos out front smoking cigarrettes. My loins quiver and my heart flutters, but I keep walking anyway. Shame on me for being such a pussy.
author: emily w.

description: I used to live a block from here. Great spot to meet a friend and work out a bad day with some whiskey or vodka. They have movie nights and we like that idea.
author: Soren A.

description:
as we walked by on our way to eat mexican down the street, some crusty looking guys out front smoking leaned over to check out my sister's (admittedly voluptuous) ass, and croaked out "hot damn!" there's a reason she never wears pants. 

since one of the friends i had dragged with me is on a liquid diet (aka he's alcoholic) he decided to pop in here while the rest of us ate. we came back to find him, but ended up staying for about an hour. 

it's the kind of place where there are many more dudes than chicks, and i had the feeling it would not be hard to get laid. as long as i didn't mind the smell of stale beer and alcohol on my potential date's breath. 

we ordered anchor porter on tap for $4, and watched "wipeout" on abc, and laughed at all the out of shape people making fools of themselves by face-planting into mud. oh yeah, great music too. good times, good times. 

very unpretentious. although the bathroom looks sketchy, it was in fact quite clean and well-stocked. cash only.
author: Anna S.

description: I like dark divey spots, so I am biased.  And this was a nice level of Dive.  And the nice woman at the bar told me I look like J-Lo's husband.  I don't see it, but she was sweet.
author: Bryan H.

description: This is a place for alcoholics, those on the fast track to joining them, and those that only want to spend a night with them (and the next day regretting it).  I think the former leader of the SF Hells Angels was stabbed outside.  I too have received a permanent scar here, I think I've ended up bleeding twice actually.  So, thirsty-enabler-user-bloodbath might be appropriate?  But, to be fair that happened back when it was the Treat St. bar.  The bartenders are efficient and usually conversational, it's reliably not-too crowded, there's space to talk and think, and I'll never oppose a stop in (just make sure you have someone to pull you out).
author: Kathryn M.

description:
After the grace and aplomb with which the staff handled our takeover-size going-away party and all if its attendant personalities, not to mention the shockingly huge Mexican buffet that sprung up around the pool table, I've gotta go with five stars for this place. 

Though I've always been a Thieves fan, I wasn't totally sold on the most recent addition to their mini empire until last Saturday. The bartenders were friendly and fun and they tolerated our loud, obnoxious (and I'd like to think nice and good-tipping) group not only with excellent demeanor, but with genuine good nature. We shredded their bar with bad dancing and drank all the Fernet and had a blast and if they had bad feelings about the experience, they waited until after the bar doors closed behind us at 2 a.m. to utter them.

Yes, yes, the old dirty Treat Street bar and its beheaded animals are missed by many--I loved that bar, too. I've watched my share of perfectly fabulous dive bars get heartlessly sold over to new owners who give them the inevitable face lift and soldier on under slightly classier conditions. It happens. Get over it. Dirty Thieves is a perfectly respectable establishment for drinking hard and long and rocking out.
author: Sage R.

description: Love it. When I'm tired of all the DBs in my neighborhood, this is where I go. Pleasantly divey, usually at least one IPA on tap, great friendly bartenders. A great place to sit at the bar and chat with bartenders and whoever happens to be sitting next to you, or bring some friends and cozy up in one of the big booths. I also noticed lately on a particularly cold night that it's one of the few dive bars that seems to have heat...
author: robin b.

description:
Big Chris has taken to coming over once a week to "keep it real" and offer support, advice and ass-slapping. He's like my therapist, his pearls of wisdom are so fantastic. Although I must admit, I've never had a therapist who sported Air Jordans and openly discussed my boobs.
Anyway, Chris is pretty insistent that Dirty Thieves become our new hangout and I have to admit, this place rocks. I was initially afraid to enter this place, but I was soon converted by the strong ass drinks, awesome bar staff and friendly regulars who look like they'd kick my ass, but are really quite lovely. 
Sure, a couple of the characters scare the shit out of me, and the last time we were there, a fight broke out by the pool table. But all in all, I always have a great time. 
And, it's so close to my house and the drinks are so packed with alcohol, Chris always gets drunk enough to agree to hang out until the wee hours and watch Muriel's Wedding. 
So, you know, bonus...
author: Beth S.

description:
I think I found my new favorite neighborhood bar. Too bad it's a bit of a walk from my house, but oh well, I will make the trek. 

There was a great selection of reasonably priced drinks and the bartender was super nice. We kept asking him for advice on what kind of scotch to get and he patiently let us taste different stuff prior to ordering. 

The decor had me cracking up the entire night.  A bunch of empty picture frames on the wall... ha ha, get it????
author: A K.

description: Thieves is close to the boys house so we end up here a lot and its always a good time. We came here on election night and had some $2 pabst. Good music, the bartenders are cool and this was the place I forced said boyfriend to do a jaeger bomb. Good memories! Oh and the touch screen games at the bar are always entertaining.
author: Britney K.

description: I came here to meet some friends of mine earlier this week, and would've had a fine time except for this really drunk and what seemed like, coked out guy that kept harassing our group. He kept coming up and trying to grope the girls we were with, trying to aggressively introduce himself to our party even though we repeatedly asked him to leave us alone. I think his name was Jackson or something like that. I've seen him up here and complained about him before, but this last week was the final straw, everyone in the bar was annoyed with him, and neither me or any of my friends will be returning as long as they have idiot regulars selling and doing drugs in there, being allowed to harass the other customers.
author: Tom K.

description: This is a fine neighborhood dive.  A lot of people are writing, "this place sucks because it's not like when it was treat".  Who cares?  The pool table is always free, happy hour ends at 8, and the jukebox is good.  Plus the bartender last night was awesome and gave us happy hour prices even though we missed the cut off by 15 minutes.  I think it aspires to be like Pop's which is a little annoying, but until coked-up scary girls start showing up I'll continue to frequent Dirty Thieves.
author: Ann C.

description: A good local dive bar. Friendly bartender, $3-5 beer, though at $4 for a Anchor Steam Porter why bother with $3 commercial beers. They also have Chimay for $6. Happy to have it stumbling distance from my house.
author: Rich R.

description: Fuck this place. They fuck over their employees, their customers, and treat people like shit. The owner and manager are just awful. Don't support it
author: Khate R.

description: Solid dive bar. I'm giving it 4 stars for the comfy booth seating!!
author: Sarah B.

description: This is a cool spot.  Drinks are reasonably priced, the bartenders were friendly and just the right amount of "dive-ness" for me.  And to soak up all that alcohol, El Farrolito is walking distance son!   Chimay on tap!
author: Ramon L.

description: I used to live on the same block as Dirty Thieves, and during this time I referred to this bar as my living room.  It's an unpretentious, neighborhood crowd in a low frills environment.  This was previously The Treat Street Bar, and the overall ambiance and clientele are the same, though ironically enough Dirty Thieves feels a bit more cleaned up then the dusty, graffiti-on-the-walls Treat Street Bar.
author: Brian S.

description: I don't know what it used to be, all I know is what it is now: A serviceable Mission Dive with cheap drinks, a phenomenal jukebox, & plenty of elbow room. I don't live nearby & doubt I'd make a special effort to hop down from the West Add for a beverage, but every neighborhood needs a dive, & this place qualifies. If for nothing else, then for the fact that a drunk old guy got pissed that I washed my hands before leaving the restroom. SOLID!
author: Pete J.

description: The ol' Treat Street has movie night on mondays. How this escaped me I don't know. Saw 'True Romance' last night with a complimentary snack, and a 6 dollar Bullet and PBR special. YEAH! The bartender didn't kick me out...BONUS!
author: wayne s.

description: Kronenberg (spl?) on tap..mmmm yes! cHIMAY ON TAP!mmmm , i have been when its been dead and at night when its been alive. I prefer dead, just because I prefer drinking in solitude. J.k either way the crowd is cool, bartenders are "aite" and its overall my choice off the main mission crowded spots and the box...has a sweet selection. Parking is always available and for some reason I was walking around there the other day and it sounded like I was walking in the tropics of Vallarta, crazy amounts of birds in the trees right around. (ramble ramble). hmmm I did get a cute kiss there once.. hmm so overall good experiences.....
author: Gen O.

description: i haven't been here since it was the treat street bar, and dirty thieves does the job.  drinks are cheap, and it's cash only.
author: Sheri N.

description: great place for a drink without a huge crowd.  lots of locals.  i wish the girl with dark hair was bartending more... she's super cool and makes the best drinks
author: mission girl g.

description: yeah... bartender was awesome, neighborhood is it what it is, decent selection of whiskey.  been to my share of dives all over the world, a thousand times more sketchy than this.  but never been somewhere that had s*hit-covered toilet paper in an open garbage-can.  no joke.  wtf.  not going to ever go back.
author: King E.

description: Supposedly used to be one of the most dangerous corners in all of SF. Times have changed, it's still a little sketchy but an excellent place to meet decent folk. Hell of a lot better place to hangout than the phone booth or pops. Radderberger is excellent on tap.
author: blimp w.

description: $4 drafts. that's cool. the booths are nice. I went there on halloween...its dark and sometimes when i walk by the place, it creeps me out. i'm on the fence about if i would ever go back there again.
author: Anita C.
